CatDescriptText: Mrs. Evelyn Cooper, 152 Canton Street, Beechview, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1958, pg.2 with question: "Do people, whom you know, place more emphasis on social life than civic responsibilities?" answer reads: "Most of the people place the emphasis on having a good time other than doing the things which are necessary."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Evelyn Cooper, wearing light colored button down coat with dark plush collar, dark hat with small bow in front, eyeglasses, holding paper bag and dark handbag, standing in front of store window displaying alarm clocks, bottles of Crescent wintergreen isopropyl alcohol, and boxes of General Electric flash bulbs, sign in window inscribed "Alcohol with Wintergreen reduced to 39c" and "cigarettes with matches 24c"
